role.descr: lost component, cut out component // intron, exon, or more than one of them //
location refering to organelle, cell or tissue

example.text: CD1c has a duplicated form of this exon that is thought to be spliced out.
example.arg: a duplicated form of this exon
example.fdg:

example.text: We have shown that in the human, as in the chicken, one exon is spliced out of the MLC3nm transcript in smooth muscle to give an alternative product.

example.text: Three of the revertants obtained from the null allele unc-68(e540), which displayed normal motility, had intragenic mutations that resulted in failure to splice out intron 21.

example.text: Failure to splice out this intron resulted in a substitution of the final 13 amino acids of the deduced amino acid sequence.

example.text: Virtually all genes of higher organisms have non-coding introns interspersed between the coding exons that must be spliced out in order to generate a mature messenger RNA molecule used to encode proteins.
example.arg: a mature messenger RNA molecule used to encode proteins
example.fdg:
1 Virtually virtually ad:>2 @AD-A> %E> ADV 2 all all det:>3 @DN> %>N DET 3 genes gene subj:>7 @SUBJ %NH N NOM PL 4 of of mod:>3 @6 @A> %>N A CMP 6 organisms organism pcomp:>4 @

example.text: In the remaining allelic p53 gene, there was a single-base substitution of G to T at position 1 within the splice donor site of intron 7, and the mutated intron was not spliced out during the mRNA maturation process.
